revised_title: Investigation of the Hydrolysis of Cane Sugar by Dilute Acids
tldr: The author investigates the hydrolysis of cane sugar by dilute acids and finds that the rate of change decreases as the reaction proceeds, contrary to previous findings suggesting a linear relationship. The study also highlights the errors that can arise from applying the mass action equation in the usual way and emphasizes the importance of accurate initial readings and temperature control in such experiments.
